note.p: Birth: London, England (09 June 1875)
Death: Cambridge (23 July 1968)
Research Field: Physiology, pharmacology
Education: Leys School; Trinity College, Cambridge; St Bartholomew's Medical School, London. MD

Career: George Henry Lewes Studentship, Institute of Physiology, University College London; Wellcome Physiological Research Laboratories, Brockwell Park, (1904); Director (1906); joined Central Research Institute of the Medical Research Committee which was to become the Medical Research Council (1914); Secretary of Royal Society's Shock Committee; Member, General Medical Council (1927-1937); served on National Institute for Medical Research (1928-1942); Trustee, Wellcome Trust; Trustee, British Museum (1940-1963); Member, Medical Research Council (1942-1946); President, British Council (1950-1963); Chairman, Wellcome Trust (1938-1960); Director, Royal Institution
Honours: CBE 1919; Kt 1932; GBE 1943; OM 1944
Membership: Fellow
Election Date: 7/05/1914
Medals/Prizes: Royal Medal 1924; Copley Medal 1937; Nobel Prize (Physiology or Medicine) 1936
Lectures: Croonian 1919
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DSB
Obituaries: Biographical Memoirs of Fellows of the Royal Society 1970 vol 16 pp 77-174, plate, by W S Feldberg
